articles.title: School district that warned parents of foster care wouldn't let me erase lunch debts, CEO says
articles.description: A coffee company CEO said the Wyoming Valley West School Board president rejected his offer to pay $22,000 in lunch debts. The district had warned parents of foster care if they did not pay their lunch bills.
articles.content:
A Pennsylvania school district that warned parents that unpaid lunch fees could lead to their children being placed in foster care rejected a businessman's offer to clear the debts, a Philadelphia CEO said.
